title: Do I need to know ABAP to learn SAP UI5? - Quora

response.answer_text: One word answer: No SAP UI5 is, as given by the name, a user -interface designing platform designed in JavaScript, HTML, CSS, etc. It doesn't require any knowledge of ABAP. However, as is the case with all UIs, we need to feed data to this interface from back end. This data feeding is generally done through Odata services. Odata is nothing but a protocol named open data protocol which governs the rules for feeding data to UI5 applications. The data, here, is extracted through ABAP code. Thus, if you are aiming for only a UI5 developer designing interfaces, you don't need ABAP. However, for complete application development, you will need some basic knowledge of ABAP.

Hello, In Order to Learn SAPUI5 you need the following: 1.HTML5 2.CSS3 3.Javascript 4.Jquery 5.XML/Json These are frontend web technologies . ABAP is backend for SAPUI5 . If you want to become a full stack developer then ABAP is needed. If your interest is in frontend development, ABAP is not needed. Best Regards, Rekha

Well, there are two things , if you want to be a front end developer then you don't need ABAP knowledge. Front-end is more or less related to JAVA,CSS and HTML5. But there is a second part to it which is Gateway, it's all about pulling data from SAP and sending it to UI5 application.So for this you need ABAP knowledge. There are requirements for people who are aware of ABAP and Gateway . OData and Gateway services are same and if you are aware of ABAP then you can easily work on Gateway.

SAPUI5 (SAP user interface for HTML 5) is a collection of libraries that developers can use to build desktop and mobile applications that run in a browser. With SAP'sSAPUI5 JavaScript toolkit, developers can build SAP web applications using HTML5 web development standards. SAP is also making good progress in providing development tools to speed up implementations. The best tool is Web IDE, which is available in the HANA Cloud and as a local installation.In a nutshell, if you are planning to work as developer in SAP related domain, it’s time to learn and get familiar with SAPUI5. SAPUI5 mainly requires HTML5, jQuery, CSS etc. as prerequisites. It is the front-end technology which is used to implement user interface. While HANA is database and backend technology. For the growth and the technology, they are two different paths, equally worth. Both of them got big prospective and a bright future. Both of them has very good scope in terms of career in India and Abroad as well.Based on your interest and knowledge, you may choose any path. NO, you don’t want ABAP to learn SAP UI5 To learn SAP UI5, you should have a basic knowledge on HTML5, Javascript and CSS You can do the UI5 course on Enterprise MOOCs: Learn anywhere, anytime and on any device! is really great. It's free and still open for self paced learning. I would really recommend this course if you're interested in picking up UI5

No. There is no need to learn ABAP if you want to learn Ui5 It is mandatory for you to have the knowledge on JavaScript HTML and CSS. after all these when you are getting experience ui5 then you need to understand gateway services.and so on...
